document_title: Cerebral vascular occlusion: Signs, causes, treatment and prevention
subsection_content:
Vascular blockages in the extracranial carotid artery can be heard with a stethoscope, but most cerebrovascular problems can be identified through imaging techniques. Through recorded images, doctors can see the condition of large arteries, small blood vessels and even brain tissue.
Some commonly used imaging methods to diagnose cerebral vascular occlusion include: (2)
Computed tomography (CT scan); Brain MRI, especially the modern 3 Tesla MRI machine at Tam Anh General Hospital System can help detect the smallest abnormalities in cerebral blood vessels.; Transcranial doppler ultrasound; Digital subtraction angiography (DSA angiography); Carotid Doppler ultrasound; Magnetic resonance angiography (MRA)
Specialists will consider and choose the most appropriate diagnostic method for the patient.
Imaging techniques can help detect abnormalities in brain blood vessels
